instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board with water damage in <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> area. First there was no green light and ppbus. Fixed it replacing <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>. 

Now when plug magsafe it going orange -> green - > orange -> just like something is reseting smc constantly. Checked SMC _RESET_L and it has 3.4 V droping to 3V when charger light goes green. 

There was corrosion near J6100 and i removed it completely. 

Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and check if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> still fluctuates.
Use o-scope, if possible; it can show if voltage drop to 0V.

Post all voltages of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
Take time and check which ones fluctuates.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Removed <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is stable. Magsafe orange.
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>
1 3.4V
2 0V
3 3.4V
4 2.8V
53,4V (about 0,1V fluctuation)
63,4V (about 0,02V fluctuation)
7 3,4V (about 0,02V fluctuation)
8 3,3 V
Right now dont have o-scope. Can try to check it tomorrow.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message: Already changed but will try again. Muchas gracias informaticos :)
